stream_context.summary: Kaze focuses on polishing the overworld’s first coastal/mountain area: tweaking shaders, adding plants and cave textures, planning a reflective lighthouse material, and preparing a beta-test build.

development_findings.summary: Kaze’s immediate milestone is to finish the overworld’s base shaders (corals, volcano, cave, lighthouse) so a beta build can be sent to testers.
development_findings.quote: I wanna get this ready for beta testing so we can ship it off to the beta testers.

development_findings.summary: The overworld must feel like a believable place, so Banjo-style level nameplates were rejected to avoid a "gamey" vibe.
development_findings.quote: Nope. That makes the overworld feel very gamey and I want this to feel placey.

development_findings.summary: Entrance to the Bunny Burrow will look welcoming but is gated by a Pachyderm NPC who can be bribed with 10 coins or flipped with a ground pound.
development_findings.quote: We want the player to feel invited, that makes the guy blocking the entrance even better.

development_findings.summary: Kaze is adding a universal cut-scene skip: holding A shows a fast-forward icon; after ~30 frames the scene aborts.
development_findings.quote: Hold A and a widget appears… once you hold A for 30 frames the cutscene just stops and you’re right in the action.

development_findings.summary: Rain in the ship level is implemented as true 3-D world-space rain, not screen-space effects.
development_findings.quote: The rain in the ship level is genuine 3D rain in world space, and I like it that way.

development_findings.summary: Water visuals have been overhauled; viewers now compliment the water before Kaze even tweaks it further.
development_findings.quote: People have been telling me the water looks awesome since before the water looked awesome.

development_findings.summary: The final ROM is hard-capped at exactly 64 MB to stay within vanilla N64 constraints.
development_findings.quote: I limited myself to exactly 64 megabytes; the final ROM is probably going to be exactly 64 megabytes.

development_findings.summary: A reflective combiner for the lighthouse will reuse an earlier building-reflection shader designed with Akumoid, but Fast64 preview bugs are blocking progress.
development_findings.quote: Something really fucked is going on here… I will have to debug this upstream.

development_findings.summary: Course 4 is also being polished concurrently for the same beta build, though only one private tester will initially see it.
development_findings.quote: I've been getting course 4 from the beta test ready… the beta test being me sending the ROM to one person.

development_findings.summary: Kaze plans to buy the original Mario 64 instrument samples so that the RTYI soundtrack can be sold legally.
development_findings.quote: I should just buy all the samples used in the Mario 64 OST because what if at some point I wanna sell the RTYI OST?

development_findings.summary: A new emulator build with improved audio is now Kaze’s primary dev environment.
development_findings.quote: Look how much better the audio sounds in this emulator—it’s crazy.

development_findings.summary: Fast64 sometimes multiplies texture alpha during preview, causing in-editor artefacts that do not occur in-game; Kaze intends to fix the plugin upstream.
development_findings.quote: If the plugin exported my texture correctly, that pattern is not there… I'll have to debug this upstream.

context_findings.summary: Kaze balances full-time Unreal Engine 5 employment, YouTube sponsorship-supported videos, game development, and parenting.
context_findings.quote: Development of this game was a lot faster before I had a job… I do have a full-time job outside of making this game.

context_findings.summary: He avoids showing his daughter on stream for privacy reasons.
context_findings.quote: I don't know if I wanna present my daughter on stream so much.

context_findings.summary: Kaze views stock-market investing as gambling and calls himself a gambler, illustrating a pragmatic, risk-tolerant mindset.
context_findings.quote: Honestly, I am a gambler… even now I am still invested in the stock market.

context_findings.summary: He is frustrated by condescending StackOverflow answers and compiler ‘knows better’ attitudes, reinforcing his self-image as an optimisation-focused coder.
context_findings.quote: Both times it was like, ‘the compiler knows better than you, topic closed’… you guys have no idea what you're talking about.

context_findings.summary: He considers himself in the top 2–3 % of programmers but admits limited formal training and a smaller knowledge base.
context_findings.quote: No bragging… skill-wise I'm at least a top 2 % or 3 % programmer; knowledge-wise, probably not.

context_findings.summary: Patreon Discord is rarely used and functions as a ‘hard-core audience’ channel for very occasional updates.
context_findings.quote: I kinda consider [the Patreon Discord] like the hardcore audience where I post stuff there that usually people on YouTube wouldn't care.

context_findings.summary: Kaze is wary yet curious about gambling-site sponsorship offers, asking viewers how they’d react if he accepted one.
context_findings.quote: Guys, how mad would you be at me if I took a gambling sponsorship on YouTube?

biobak.summary: Biobak will ‘rework’ the placeholder shaders and textures; Kaze intentionally leaves colour accuracy to him.
biobak.quote: I don't need to get all the colors perfect on the first try… because Biobak is gonna rework some of this anyway.

biobak.summary: Biobak recently showed Kaze improved vine textures that he may incorporate.
biobak.quote: Biobak showed this to me just recently—it has eyes?

biobak.summary: Kaze expects Biobak to overhaul course visuals later, e.g., the still-rough lighthouse/mountain area.
biobak.quote: Biobak hasn't reworked it yet, so it's still a little ugly.

badub.summary: No direct stream contribution; soundtrack discussion implies Badub would benefit from legally-purchased Mario 64 samples.

zeina.summary: Zeina is responsible for implementing the cut-scene skip UI element.
zeina.quote: Zeina, did you end up making the skip button? I wanna add a functionality to skip cutscenes.

zeina.summary: She previously animated Pachyderm’s gate-blocking behaviour (implied by Kaze referencing her work).

key_stories.title: A Welcoming Burrow with a Gatekeeper
key_stories.summary: Kaze wants the Bunny Burrow entrance to feel friendly, lined with flowers and carrots, yet the path is blocked by a Pachyderm NPC. The contrast should entice players while introducing an early puzzle.
key_stories.challenge: Make an inviting entrance that still prevents immediate access.
key_stories.process: Added colourful plants, vines and carrots; designed Pachyderm behaviour (pay 10 coins or ground-pound to flip him).
key_stories.outcome: Visual prototype completed; mechanic approved for beta-test; Biobak will polish art later.
key_stories.key_quote: We want the player to feel invited—that makes the guy blocking the entrance even better.

key_stories.title: Designing Universal Cut-scene Skipping
key_stories.summary: Players will be able to skip any cut-scene by holding A. A fast-forward icon with a filling circle communicates progress, and after ~30 frames the scene cancels.
key_stories.challenge: Provide skippable story moments without accidental presses.
key_stories.process: Kaze defines UX, asks Zeina to make the widget, and notes debounce behaviour (fill drains when released).
key_stories.outcome: Feature spec finished; implementation assigned to Zeina.
key_stories.key_quote: Once you hold A for 30 frames, the cutscene just stops and you're right in the action.

key_stories.title: The Lighthouse Reflection Bug
key_stories.summary: Kaze attempts to port a metallic-reflection shader to the lighthouse, but Fast64’s preview multiplies alpha incorrectly, making debugging difficult.
key_stories.challenge: Misleading editor preview hides the correct in-game result.
key_stories.process: Created RGBA reflection map, tested multiple combiners, identified Fast64 alpha bug.
key_stories.outcome: Shader postponed; Kaze will debug plugin upstream before continuing.
key_stories.key_quote: Something really messed is going on here… If the plugin exported my texture correctly, that pattern is not there.
